DOC.brief_summary: Aims : To investigate whether acute ingestion palm oil effect appetite regulation Design : A randomized , single blind , cross design include 4 single study visit separate week . Visit 1 acclimatization visit follow visit 2,3 , 4 different type fat give . Population : 12 healthy male female age 18 60 year body mass index ( BMI ) 18.5- 29.9kg/m2 normal fast plasma glucose evidence insulin resistance recruit . No-pre exist morbidity include cardiac , hepatic renal disease , history diabetes , hypertension hyperlipidaemia . Treatment : Acclimatization visit : At visit 1 , participant give milkshake like drink contain fat , protein carbohydrate . A cannula insert duration study day blood take . Studies show first visit stress response affect metabolic response study drink result inaccurate result . Study visit 2,3,4 : following acclimatization visit , participant attend 3 study visit separate week test metabolic response follow fat : palm olein , interesterified palm olein soybean oil random order . Participants ask complete visual analogue scale questionnaire appetite time point . Fasting postprandial plasma glucose , insulin , appetite hormone lipid measure .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Palm Olein Intake Lipid Profile Appetite Regulation
DOC.criteria: Healthy overweight male female volunteer ethnicity ( body mass index ( BMI ) 18.529.9 kg/m2 ) Age 1860 year ( inclusive ) Abnormal liver function test ( elevate alanine aminotransferase aspartate transaminase ) / abnormal kidney function test ( elevate plasma creatinine ) History type 2 diabetes mellitus , cancer , stomach ulcer , drug abuse alcoholism , gastrointestinal disorder like Crohn 's disease Smokers On lipid/blood pressure lower medication/supplements Blood pressure > 140/90 mm Hg Fasting total cholesterol > 6.2 mmol/L Fasting triacylglyceride > 2.0 mmol/L Subject must allergic intervention Pregnancy breastfeeding ( pregnancy test undertaken screen visit ) Subjects take nutritional supplement weightloss program Subjects gain lose â‰¥ 3kg weight past three month Subjects history hypo hyperthyroidism Subjects anaemic donate blood within three month study
